resource.description: The AWS::CodeDeploy::Application resource creates an AWS CodeDeploy application

properties.name: ApplicationName
properties.description: A name for the application. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the application name.

type.description: A name for the application. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the application name.

properties.name: ComputePlatform
properties.description: The compute platform that CodeDeploy deploys the application to.

type.description: The compute platform that CodeDeploy deploys the application to.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The metadata that you apply to CodeDeploy applications to help you organize and categorize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define.

type.description: The metadata that you apply to CodeDeploy applications to help you organize and categorize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define.
